Description: Thoughts repeatedly return to death as the central theme, crowding out other cognition.
Planning, methodical thinking, and emotional justification around suicide.
Persistent hopelessness drains motivation, creating mental shutdown.
Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
Recursive dwelling on flaws, mistakes, and burdening others.
Difficulty distinguishing inner perception from external reality.
Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
Intense focus on bodily sensations and emotions as objects of analysis.
Overwhelmed thought pattern marked by 'no escape' framing.
Self-questioning driven by tension between beliefs, norms, and feelings.
Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
Constructing self-identity through past struggles and emotional impact.
Scattershot, fragmented expression under mental overload.
